subject: Self Care
title: Gratitude in Hardship
description: A micro-lesson that makes Gratitude in Hardship usable.

hook.text: Viktor Frankl found meaning in a concentration camp. If gratitude can exist there, it can exist in your hard season too.

buildup.text: Gratitude during suffering doesn't mean being thankful for the pain. It means finding light that coexists with the darkness.

discovery.text: Post-traumatic growth research shows that adversity often deepens gratitude. People who've suffered value small joys more.

twist.text: Forcing gratitude in crisis is toxic. Allowing it to emerge naturally is healing. The difference is pressure versus permission.

climax.text: In hard times, don't force big gratitudes. Start impossibly small: warm water, a kind word, one deep breath. Small is enough.

punchline.text: In dark times, find one small light. That's gratitude enough.

quiz.question: How should gratitude be approached during genuine hardship?
